intro: Palicourea lachnantha, commonly known as the white-flowered palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in tropical regions of Brazil, Colombia, and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape and have a glossy surface. Palicourea lachnantha is often found in shaded, humid environments such as forests and undergrowth areas.
